subject: Power, Power, POWER!!!!
event: The HOLLYWOOD REPORTER says I am the third most powerful writer in Hollywood:  http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/person/george-rr-martin Mwaaaahahahahaha.  (Rubs hands together)   What shall I do with such awesome power? Let me banish all reality shows from the air! And these 'talent' shows too!  Instead of shows where assholes and audiences mack mock of wannabees who cannot sing and dance, let's bring back the variety show and feature really GOOD singers and really GOOD dancers. Oh, and you movie studios... no more replacing screenwriters at the drop of a hat.  It should as hard to replace the writer as it is to replace the director.  And that "a film by" credit at the beginning of pictures should include the name of BOTH writer and director.  The film is by both of them, not just one. And every TV series should be required to take X amount of pitches from freelancer writers and beginners.  That used to be mandated by the WGA, and way back when it was how a lot of newcomers got their foot in the door, but these days most shows find ways around it, and breaking in is harder than ever. Since I am so so powerful, I know all this will come to pass! (And if it does, I have a bride to sell you). ((BRIDGE! I meant bridge.))

comments.article: It's time you made an album of ASOIAF songs so you can start your path toward an EGOT.
comments.subject: Mooohahahahahahahaha

comments.article: Working on it.
comments.subject: Re: Mooohahahahahahahaha

comments.article: Hear, Hear!
Nice! I agree with all these Royal Decrees.
I couldn't have said it better.
comments.subject: Amazing!!

comments.article: Could you also banish the Nielson ratings. They have destroyed so many good shows by not giving them the chance they need to evolve and develop, and they are in general totally inaccurate and damn stupid way to judge who's watching what. Thank you so much for considering my request your Awesomeness.

If only GRRM had this much control over the real world,

maybe it'd make it just as interesting as his books!
Love you, Sir! Greetings from Brazil <3
comments.subject: <3

comments.article:
(And if it does, I have a bride to sell you).

I've got a goat around here somewhere...
Congratulations on being number three!  You definitely deserve the awesome power.  Please have mercy on us loyal fans, Master Martin!
comments.subject: Congratulations!

comments.article: I'm currently visiting santa fe and would love to leave you a tribute (since you are so powerful) of my moms tamales (she makes me a huge amount to take home) at your theater but I don't know if you go often enough to get them nice and fresh. If not I'm sure you awesome theater crew would enjoy them.
Yes, I get to the theatre a couple times a week, unless I am travelling... but my staff will gladly store the gift... if they don't eat it.

comments.upictitle: smoking catnip and chasing my tail: pic#55124229
comments.article:
Let me banish all reality shows from the air!

Ohpleaseohpleaseohplease!
If only.
It must be funny scrolling through a list and finding yourself on it. Right up at the top nonetheless!
how much for the bride ;-)
Do you like dragons

I've said it once (to you at Len's house), and I'll say it again. I love you, George.

:-)
Good job. You can still be number one!
Getting rid of reality and talent - type shows would be awesome.  Even my phone hates them, since it wanted to autocorrect that to talent - Typhoid.

Haha I don't know about you being powerful in Hollywood or not, but I know for a fact that you're simply the best author that ever lived. At least the best that I know of. Looking forward to winds of winter! :)
How much for the bride? =P

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: shrimp
comments.article: Bah, your first move should be to vanquish #1 and #2!
A *bride* to sell me? And what does Parris have to say about THAT?
I was already counting up goats and guppies in my head, then I saw the correction.
Hey, BEAUTY AND THE BEAST did great work with smoke machines.
and he surrounds himself with a bevy of beautiful minions!
comments.subject: power

comments.article: When did you read my mind on the subject of "if I had the power to make some changes in TV land?"  PLEASE DO IT
Sadly, the number three writer is about as powerful as the number 3298th associate producer.
You da' man, George!!!
